results.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage
results.brief_description: Undertaken in partnership with Alzheimer’s Australia, Vic Memory’s Voice captures the stories of ten people impacted by dementia. These powerful stories examine the complexities of the condition ‘ the losses, the adjustments and the need to move forward ‘ preserving the spirit of the families involved and creating life long tributes to personal achievement.
results.description: Undertaken in partnership with Alzheimer’s Australia, Vic Memory’s Voice captures the stories of ten people impacted by dementia. results.title: Memories for mum
results.brief_description: Since emigrating from Malta in the 60’s, Tess and her husband have faced many challenges living in Australia and raising their boys. As Tess is now suffering from Alzheimer’s disease, her husband and sons pay tribute to a truly great woman. Created as part of ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ in association with Vic Helath and the Alzheimer’s Association.

group.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage

results.title: Carmel: storyteller
results.brief_description: Carmel is a retired school teacher, wife, mother and grandmother. Her family’ s life dramatically changed when she was diagnosed with early onset memory loss. With her husband, she tells their story and looks positively in the face of an unknown future. Created as part of the ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ workshop, an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with Alzheimer’s Australia Vic and in partnership with VicHealth.

group.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage

results.title: A Moomba Magic Moment
results.brief_description: It all started with my promotional photo and my girlfriend Gail Gordon, she entered me into the Moomba Quest, and the rest is history. A digital story created to celebrate 50 years of Melbourne Moomba Water Fest.

results.title: Memories of a Birdman
results.brief_description: “My name is George Abel and it’s now thirty years since the idea of the Birdman Rally struck me.” A digital story created to celebrate 50 years of Melbourne Moomba Water Fest.

results.title: Moom
results.brief_description: Mum and I would laugh at how the Moomba festival was named after our deadly mooms. Moom refers to our bottoms. A digital story created to celebrate 50 years of Melbourne Moomba Water Fest.

results.title: Moomba belonged to my grandfather
results.brief_description: Moomba belonged to my grandfather, Tom Wittingslow. Of all the shows and carnivals we did all over Australia, Moomba was the best. A digital story created to celebrate 50 years of Melbourne Moomba Water Festival.

results.title: Memories of Moomba
results.brief_description: A selection of short films made in a Digital Storytelling workshop held to celebrate 50 years ofthe Moomba festival. The stories explore the history of the parade and life as a sun queen of moomba. It traces the history of the well known carnival family, and highlights the achievements of the key figures involved in the wild and wacky water events. Memories of Moomba was produced in collaboration with City of Melbourne and Melbourne Moomba Waterfest.
